intro: Thesium gracile, commonly known as slender thesium, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, upright growth habit and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and evergreen, adapted to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils. Thesium gracile is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
